questions.question: Equating the numerator to zero gives ___ and equating denominator to zero gives us ___ ?

A transfer function has two zeroes at infinity.
The numerator degree (N) and denominator degree (M) are related as :
The principle of homogeneity and principle of superposition are applicable to
The transfer function of is the ratio of

answers.a: Laplace transform of Input to that of the Output
answers.b: Fourier transform of Input to that of the Output
answers.c: Laplace transform of Output to that of the Input
answers.d: Fourier transform of Output to that of the Input

questions.question: Which of the following statement is correct?

answers.a: The value of transfer function is zero at poles.
answers.b: The value of transfer function is infinity at zeroes.
answers.c: The value of transfer function is infinity at poles.
